#5 ways it will transform Android phones in 2026  
*(Source: [Hindustan Times](https://www.hindustantimes.com/technology/snapdragon-8-elite-gen-5-processor-5-ways-it-will-transform-android-phones-in-2026-101759140495935-amp.html))*

## üöÄ Overview  
- Qualcomm has unveiled the **Snapdragon 8 Elite Gen 5**, positioned as a flagship 5th-generation chip for upcoming Android phones.  
- The chip promises enhancements across AI, performance, video, gaming, battery, and connectivity.  

## üîç Five Key Transformations

1. **On-Device AI Learning**  
   - The upgraded Neural Processing Unit (NPU) is ~37% faster and uses ~16% less power.  
   - Enables continuous, multimodal AI inference offline, helping phones adapt to user behavior without relying on cloud.  

2. **Video Recording Upgrades**  
   - Introduces support for the **Advanced Professional Video (APV)** codec (launched with Android 16).  
   - Allows high-bitrate professional video capture; each frame can act as a high-res still image.  

3. **Faster CPU & Console-Level Gaming**  
   - New third-generation Oryon cores reach up to **4.6 GHz**.  
   - CPU performance up ~20%, GPU ~23%, while lowering power draw by ~20%.  
   - Support for **Unreal Engine 5**, and includes Adreno High Performance Memory (HPM) for smoother gaming.  

4. **Improved Battery Life**  
   - Built on a 3 nm process, giving ~35% better power efficiency over its predecessor.  
   - Should allow devices to handle heavy tasks with less energy draw.  

5. **Enhanced Connectivity**  
   - Integrates Qualcomm‚Äôs **X85 modem**: up to 12.5 Gbps download, 3.7 Gbps upload (‚âà 25% better than previous gen).  
   - Also supports **FastConnect 7900**, enabling Wi-Fi 7, Bluetooth 6.0, and UWB with improved power efficiency.  

## üìÖ Publication Detail  
- Published on: **Sept 29, 2025**, 03:50 pm IST  
- Author: MD Ijaj Khan  

## ‚úÖ Significance & Expectations  
- This chipset aims to bridge the gap between Android and iPhones, especially in video & AI capabilities.  
- It positions 2026 as a potential leap year for flagship Android devices with smarter, faster, and more efficient experiences.
